reviewText:
I have decided to change ths review in the frustration and annoyance it has given me.
Now. Battleblock Theater. Behemoth. Stamper. Cats.
In the begining this game will seem extremely fun and laughable like crazy.
The Campaign is great, the co-op Campaign and games are extremely fun.
But then comes the issues of a meh port.
There are many bugs, and exploits, such as the darts, that make the game either extremely fun or extremely frustrating.
Also, there are the custom levels. Oh Baby...
These custom levels featured in the Furbottom's Features are frustrating as nuts, some being buggy like crazy, and some being downright bad.

You can get heads from going on occasionally but theres also the hat that you unlock from the Features.
There's also the option to buy heads, and weapons.
I find my self needing to shell out cash for some of these heads (being a collector of heads) when I can't do the Features due to shoddy craftsman ship, etc.
So yeah.

TLDR: For those of you who want a great platformer that's some hallarious fun. Get this.

But remember, try not to dip into the Furbottom's Features or Custom Levels, as a good few of them will just make you frustrated on how it's broken.

Enjoy, and prepare to buckle yo pants.

reviewText:
Great & funny platformer. The solo campaign could be compared to Super Meat Boy except it's not as merciless and doesn't require that much incredible precision. Don't be fooled by the easy first chapters, it does crank up the difficulty around the middle of the game. There's also puzzle influences with lots of levels utilizing switches.

The co-op campaign seemed fun too, with hilarious friendly fire accidents. The arena modes induced lots of yelling with the 2v2 local multiplayer modes that were more like chaotic brawler games instead of skilled platforming. Since there's an editor built-in you can play random assortments of uploaded levels if you find the official levels dull.

In addition to the gameplay, the main draw of the game is the comedy side. The story makes no sense but it's really entertaining, mostly thanks to the narrator. The cartoony animated artstyle is great (very similar to Castle Crashers), the soundtrack is awesome and the excellent constant narrator quips make everything funny. There's hundreds of stupid looking unlockable heads to collect. Check the Steam store trailer to see if the game's particular style of wacky lolrandom crazy works for you.

As a pure platformer I'd most likely gotten bored before finishing the game, but the cartoony aesthetics carried it and I finished the main story because every raving cutscene after a chapter is a treat. The 4-person couch arena chaos is a fine addition to Broforce and Gang Beasts evenings.

reviewText:
I was honestly really skeptical of BattleBlock Theater in the beginning, but I had to buy it simply because of the trailer. I have played through the story on co-op and have gotten all As and A+s except for one B. Let me be the first to say I was absolutely wrong to be skeptical. This game got my expectations, blew them out of the water, caught them, pooped on them, then punched them into spikes and lava. It is an absolutely amazing game to play co-op. I would recommend getting this game even if you do not enjoy platformers, though I would suggest getting someone to play it with. Single player is still very fun.
Pros:
-Difficult levels. They start easy but get much harder later on.
-Co-op is fun and works well for the most part (will explain in cons).
-Steamworks and player-created levels.
-Smooth controls and very easy to learn.
-Nice controller support.
-Good and well-made game mechanics, but still very silly and enjoyable.
-Some gems and yarn (collectibles) are difficult to find and get.
-A lot of different faces to unlock.
Cons:
-Keyboard controls aren't the best, but are tolerable. (Me and my girlfriend went through all of co-op, her on a keyboard, so very much doable and tolerable, but controller is recommended)
-Boulders. If you are playing with an internet friend that is relatively far from you (probably 100-150 ms), the non-host can sometimes be killed by simply picking up a boulder and doing nothing with it.
-Yarn becomes useless after a while. It is used to purchase weapons, but you can buy all of your weapons by chapter 5 or so.
-Not a lot of replay value aside community maps.
-Some weapons are essentially useless, but can still be fun to mess around with.
Overall 9.5/10. One of the most enjoyable games I have played in a long while. It's honestly just pure, straight fun. Especially when I can punch my girlfriend into spikes.

I think that the part where you sell heads and weapons on steam trades is pretty much useless on how easy it is to get them.

reviewText: It's about time I can play a game and actually stick to it without closing it out every 30 minutes becasue I'm bored. (In this case it's becasue I'm yelling to loud and dizzyness begins to slither in.) But, I am proud to say that this game is not only fun and stresfull it is bound to keep you in the game for atleast an hour.  I really like games with Steam Workshop so after you people who just like to rush through the game there is still sorta something to play next. I don't mind spending hours and hours and hours on this game becasue not only are the level designs nice and stargtistic, they are pretty mind boggoling and any move could send you to your death. I haven't found anything TOO bad with the game, but the check-point system is a bit out and place, but it comes to show that you should think/wait before you act. I enjoy the character edit system (although I really recommend you should make your own character.) If you love Side-Scrollers with Co-op, this game is for you.\nOh and be prepared for alot of laughter. So grab a friend :P

reviewText:
This game is plenty funny and all, but I want to talk more about the gameplay itself.

There is so much content packed into this game, and it's incredible. The game doesn't have a tutorial level or anything. You learn what to do with little signs that could give you hints about an area, and you develop your skills over some time. BattleBlock Theater lets you learn about the game as you play without any interruption, and it still manages to throw something new at you once you think you've got it all down.

The platforming is flat-out fantastic. The different blocks/obstacles they created can be used in a million different ways, and the storyline perfectly demonstrates that. You can also create your own levels! There can be a million types of levels. Whether it's a speed run, or a level based on rythmic timing, you name it,  it can be made!

I give this game a 10/10! Definitely worth the money!

reviewText:
As a Beta Tester of this game, I can safely say that the bugs of this game have been worked out. Fantastic work on the port, Behemoth.

The game itself is hillarious and fun. The online works flawlessly, easy to join and doesn't lag as badly as castle crashers did (on bad connections, at least.) The voice acting and writing is the best. Gameplay plays exactly like you'd want a side scrolling puzzle platformer hybrid to play, and the music is incredibly catchy. The art style, while slightly low res in some areas, fits the humor perfectly.

The game clocks around 8 hours of play at best, but not counting the endless matches you'll be playing online or with a friend by your side. It's definately worth the price tag and then some.

Tá aí um jogo divertido. Você consegue passar bastante tempo jogando sem enjoar, o sistema de trades com os personagens deixa o jogo mais diferenciado. O estilo de arte cartoon combinou com o jogo, jogar sozinho de certa forma deixa menos divertido do que com amigos. Recomendo Controle. Porém de certa forma, as fases começam a se repetir e depois de umas 20-30 fases, você chega a enjoar um pouco.

Nota: 8/10
Você deve comprar?: Se tem um amigo pra jogar... SIM, caso contrário, vai por você.
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
As a Beta Tester of this game, I can safely say that the bugs of this game have been worked out. Fantastic work on the port, Behemoth.

The game itself is hillarious and fun. The online works flawlessly, easy to join and doesn't lag as badly as castle crashers did (on bad connections, at least.) The voice acting and writing is the best. Gameplay plays exactly like you'd want a side scrolling puzzle platformer hybrid to play, and the music is incredibly catchy. The art style, while slightly low res in some areas, fits the humor perfectly.

The game clocks around 8 hours of play at best, but not counting the endless matches you'll be playing online or with a friend by your side. It's definately worth the price tag and then some.

... EPIC GAME! Wow this is a super addicting Platform game with alot of cool elements! It's has lots of funny bits in it and I rate this 10/10 I would say that this is super fun and I love that you can edit your own puzzle. I also love that you can customize your character with items you have to earn. Like TF2, but you get items quicker, and you don't spend a penny after you have bought this amazing game. So if my message isn't coming through completely; I THINK YOU SHOULD GET THIS GAME! :D Thank you. Have a nice day :3

reviewText: BattleBlock Theater is one of the funniest games I've played. The game takes place in a deserted theater that is now overrun by cats. After your boat crashes the cats kidnap your best friend Hatty and force him into running the theater. You and all of your other friends are now prisoners being forced to perform for the audience that will pay a good amount of gems to see you get destroyed in any way possible. To complete a level you must evade all the obstacles and collect gems along the way, until you reach the exit (Note: The exit will only open if you have collected three gems or more) Like I said before this games story is hilarious but that doesn't mean the game itself is all that soft. No, the difficulty grows higher and higher until you get mad of seeing your character blow up, drown, get pierced by spikes and get eaten. The closest i can compare, in the case of despicable enemy/trap placement, is Mega Man. But don't worry your not just some helpless little performer, because you get to carry two of many insane weapons that may come in handy to kill something or to reach some areas. Control wise this game has really responsive and tight controls, but it would be best to play with a controller and not your keyboard. The multiplayer part of the game is fantastic, you can play through the story with a friend or get four people together to play a new form of basketball or challenge each other  by creating your own levels in the level creator.\n\nThis game is great for when you just want to try something different that’s  fun but at the same time challenging, so if you have money and you dont know what to do with it I really suggest buying BattleBlock Theater.

reviewText:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eSsnP2c4Bws

Battleblock Theatre is an incredibly enjoyable platformer that is enjoyable both solo or co-op. The Steam integration with it is fairly unique for a third-party title and allows a new way of building your collection of prisons and your arsenal, although the ability to import your own custom heads makes the market feel slightly redundant if you use it. The level creator allows for endless replay-ability with the Steam workshop, and the brilliant narration just seal’s the deal and adds to the overall charm of the game.

Summary:
+ Charming art style.
+ Fantastic writing and narration.
+ Great Steam integration.
+ Brilliant co-op mode.
+ Great level editor.
- Custom content makes Steam integration feel redundant.
- Combat feels slightly clunky.

reviewText: Two words for this game: silly and fun. Oh, wait, that's three. Oh well. Did I mention it was fun? But in all seriousness, this game is really rather addicting due to its unique personality. Being a platformer, the basic gameplay style is the same: jump platform to platform and avoid death. There is combat if you so wish to kill the cat guards that try to end your fabulous jumping spree, or very little if you choose not to (though you'll miss some gems, used to unlock prisoners (new faces), for that perfect score!). There is a decent variety of melee moves and a good armory of weapons, each with different effects both harmful and helpful. For example, the acid bubble: as the name implies, it's acidic, and you or any enemy who gets caught in it or going through it is killed; however you can jump on top of it and bounce off to reach new heights for some more gems or maybe the ever-so-precious yarn, used to unlock weapons. The silly storyline (it involves a boat of friends appropriately called the S.S. Friendship) and annoying-but-not-in-a-bad-way narrator are enough to motivate you through the solo campaign, though the option of the co-op campaign (same storyline, new levels) is really rather tempting, and is rewarding. Both players earn all gems and yarn earned in every level, except for the mysterious, shiny, golden hat, which keeps a slightly competetive feel to it, even though you're best friends now! There are separate achievements for beating the game on normal difficulty, co-op normal, insane, and co-op insane, so there are reasons to replay it, besides being outstandlingly fun that is. And once you tire of the storyline (or at the very least want a break, because who can ditch Hatty? Nobody, that's who.) there are several different arena" modes and the exclusive features to play through. Arena games (including King of the Hill and a silly form of Basketball) offer a competetive PvP side while the Furbottom Features offer more co-op rewards and player integration through the Steam Workshop. There is a level editor of course
date: meaning that you can endlessly spawn new challenges for you and your friends or to listen to the tears of the other players who don't realize you put some invisible block somewhere (I don't think that's possible
recommended: and if it is...don't be heartless
hoursPlayed: we're all friends here). If you're not big into silly

reviewText:
BattleBlock Theater is good. Like, crazy good. Coming into the game having watched a few videos on it, I'd thought it would have been a nice time to just fool around and murder your friends and whatnot. I got that, but what I had expected should have been more. I underestimated just how fun the game was.

You're given tight controls, clean and art that is very good to look at. The music fits the game very well and for me, personally, much like Newgrounds music does. I've found myself rather focused on the game itself to even notice the music, and when I do, Stamper's off, meowing a few times, or something. It's humourous, it's comical, the cutscenes are done in a pesudo-puppet show fashion and pulls out plenty of fun visual gags.

The level design works very well for the platforming-puzzle mechanic is has going on, and each level seemingly has those optimal designs which makes killing your friends a breeze.

The weapon seem simple at first, but they can be used to bend the game or make certain aspects easier, considering you're skilled enough to use them, which can make speedrunning much more viable.

If you are going to play this game, however, Grab a Friend, and preferably one who is perfectly fine with dying a few times by your hands, and willing to do the same! It keeps things fun, the air light, and you'll be smiling and laughing all the way.

This game is everything I like in coop platforming.  Here's several reasons why you should buy this game:

- Unlockables galore:  You can unlock countless different avatars to play as, and the functionality behind this is very satisfying.

- Low-consequence hinjinx:  Messing with your friends is going to happen when you play coop.  Dying is okay!  At least in normal mode...

- The Humor:  Oh my gosh this game is hilarious.  The narration is GOLD.  If you find the comedy style of the trailer engaging, you'll enjoy the chapter-completion monologues and the in-game commentary.

- The Execution:  Executing platforming maneuvers in this game is extremely satisfying, both single player and coop!

reviewText:
This is an abridged review!  The full written review can be viewed at http://coasterdude.moonfruit.com/#/video-game-reviews/4579924389/BattleBlock-Theater-Steam-Edition-Review/8472882.

The Behemoth have returned with another game that will blow your pants off, so be sure to keep them buckled.  The game I'm referring to is the Steam edition of  “BattleBlock Theater,” a unique platformer filled with more than enough content.  This game takes the iconic game mechanic of “press A to jump,” and twists it into a brand new experience.  It takes place on an island of prisoners that have been imprisoned by cats where they are then forced to participate in deadly stage productions that require a lot of battling and a lot of blocks.

Each level is linear, but requires you to find at least 3 gems that happen to be scattered throughout the level to unlock the exit.  There are at least 5 gems to find, and a majority of the gems are hidden inside mini-puzzles that deviate from the main path of the level.  This gives each level a much needed sense of complexity.  More importantly, the 3 gems that are required to exit the level are usually placed in spots that are almost impossible to miss.  To give the player the motivation for finding more than 3 gems, the game allows the player to use gems to purchase additional characters to play as.  However, I rarely felt compelled to find gems for the sake of a new character.  I honestly loved finding gems because of the feeling of satisfaction that I'd get from finding them in the first place.  This system of reward for exploration is astoundingly perfect.  Players that feel the need to collect as many gems as possible are well rewarded, and players that don't want to collect all of the gems are not punished.

In addition, each level has 1 ball of golden yarn, and a majority of the levels contain combative cats.  The cats I'm referring to are the enemies of the game.  Their primary purpose in life seems to be to stop the player from getting to the exit via fireballs, bouncing balls, nerf guns, etc.  Although some of the cats are placed in spots where they can easily be killed by solving a minor puzzle, there are times where the player can be ambushed and must defend themself.  This game has many weapons that the player can use to attack or defend with.  Each weapon can be purchased with 5 balls of golden yarn, and each ball of golden yarn is found within the hardest mini-puzzle of each level.  Although getting 5 balls of golden yarn for just one weapon seems like too much effort, the reward is great.  The ability to kill a cat by throwing an exploding paper airplane at them is one of the greatest satisfactions to be had from this game.

When playing a level, there is a chance of a golden hat randomly popping up somewhere.  If the golden hat is found and taken to the exit, the player is rewarded with 10 gems.  However, this is harder than it sounds because dying will cause the player to drop the hat.  If the hat is ever dropped in water, which is abundant, the hat is lost forever.  Not to mention that dying is very common in this game.  This game finds the perfect balance between having fun and being challenging.  Although it can be incredibly hard to get to the end of a level, The Behemoth make dying in this game an easy thing to handle.  This is thanks to the checkpoint system in the game.  There are many checkpoints placed on the way to the exit, so any progress lost due to a death is not too irritating.  However, for the maniacs out there, The Behemoth gives the player the option to play the whole game on just one life.  This option is called “Insane Mode” and is justly named.

Where the game truly shines is in its co-op campaign.  Although the solo and co-op campaigns are similar, the co-op levels are more fun and more hilarious the whole way through.  Each death stops being a punishment and becomes an excuse to laugh at your friend's failure.  This laughter is usually followed by the death of the laugher's character.  Solving puzzles in the co-op campaign are infinitely more fun that solving the puzzles in the solo campaign.  There truly is something magical to be felt whenever a puzzle is solved with two minds as opposed to just one.  However, the co-op campaign has one huge problem that hinders how much fun the campaign could actually be.  Although the checkpoint system still exists in the co-op campaign, the game seems rather confused about where to respawn  characters.  These respawn areas usually end up being next to the co-op partner, at the latest checkpoint, or at the previous checkpoint.  This can end up in some puzzles being solved earlier than they should or some players spawning farther back than they should.  Either of those scenarios don't seem fair.  Thankfully, even with the respawn problem, the co-op campaign never stops being fun, even in the last 2 chapters.

One of the greatest parts about the campaign mode actually has to be the plot.  That may seem like a silly thing to praise about a platformer, but the plot was surprisingly well made for this game.  Giving any of it away would be a spoiler, but how the plot is exposed is what makes it so much fun.  Each cutscene in the game is animated wonderfully and contains some of the funniest narration I have ever heard in a video game.  Each cutscene is shown at the end of a chapter, so each cutscene feels like a well-deserved reward.  The ending definitely has to be one of the most enjoyable endings I've ever seen in a video game and will definitely be creating a new fad of belt-buckling.

Aside from the campaign mode, there are also many competitive multiplayer modes that can be played by up to 4 people, but most of them fell flat for me.  They can all be described as unfair and chaotic in a bad way.  For example, there's a gamemode called “Challenge” which simply let's two teams race to the end of a level.  The team that takes the least amount of times wins.  As fun as that may sound, playing that mode was severely disappointing to me.  This was mainly because the two teams do not race at the same time.  One team goes while the other watches.  This is a major problem because a majority of the time spent on a level is puzzle-solving.  In this scenario, the team going second will always have the upper hand.  However, the “Muckle” and “Ball Game” modes are rather fun to play.  “Muckle” is simply a team deathmatch mode, which is hard to screw up, and “Ball Game” is a unique take on basketball.  However, there are many multiplayer modes out there in the gaming world that these multiplayer modes simply cannot compete with.

If you feel like this game needs more content, then you should know that there's even a level creator.  The level creator is a very useful tool that will give this game the longevity that it deserves.  Even if you're not the creative type, created levels can be downloaded.  Chances are that this game will give you many puzzles to solve and many platforms to jump on for a long time to come.

“BattleBlock Theater: Steam Edition” is a very refreshing take on a genre that has been flooded with games.  Not only is the story worth noting, but the levels are as well.  This game is challenging, but rarely stops being fun.  The co-op campaign adds a whole knew level of hilarity and fun that most co-op campaigns miss.  The level creator  definitely gives me a reason to keep checking back on the game once in a while.  However, the competitive multiplayer modes left a bad taste in my mouth.  Overall, this is definitely a game worth jumping for joy about.

reviewerDisplayName: HOUSE IN THE CORY IN THE HOUSE
reviewText:
Battleblock Theater is an awesome game. There are lots of reasons to buy this masterpiece, including the ones below:

-The Gameplay
What Battleblock Theater esentially is is a 2-d platformer with lots of fun mechanics, blocks with various behaviours, and most importantly, things that can kill you. This action is divided into 8 different chapters, with 9 levels each, a finale consisting of 2 timed levels in each chapter, and the optional encore, bringing you and the crowd back for more.

-The Story
The gist of the plot is that a boat of friends were going on an adenture, but then their terrible fate got them shipwrecked on a mysterious island. It turns out that the island is a prison maintained by cat guards, where the prisoners are put on stage with obstacles of death coming from everywhere. This pleases the audience and racks up a lot of cash, but you have one goal: to rescue your friends and escape. More of this story is told in detail with the 8 HILARIOUS cutscenes throughout the story.

-Story Mode
Story mode is the original campaign mode, which is fun to do and has VERY funny cutscenes (unless you're a cat, then it is very much offensive) and that's all there is to that.

-Insane Mode
When you've beaten story mode, you can play a version of campaign that makes you restart the level whenever you die. This way, it's not a game that remains unused in your inventory after beating the story. Insane mode is also an infuriating nightmare which will unbuckle your pants when you try to finish it, but a shiny golden trophy for your prisoner is the prize when you beat it, so I guess that's that.

-Collectibles
Every level has 3-7 gems and 1 yarn, plus a certain set time limit for a bonus. If you get all of these in a level, the A++ award is given to you. You can spend the gems on more prisoner heads and you can spend yarn on weapons, both of which are marketable and tradeable. If not that, you can keep the yarn and gems to trade later. This game also features trading cards and acheivments. Custom heads can also be made with the right software.

-Steam Workshop
The Steam Workshop contains levels all rolled up in a playlist, which are of course user-created. The level editor allows you to do this too. Furbottom's features are the weekly event in which Behemoth picks a user-created playlist that's really well-made and features it. The prize for finishing the feature is a special head.


=-Multiplayer Features
*ALL OF THE CONTENT SHOWN ABOVE IS IN MULTIPLAYER MODE TOO*

-(The campaign in multiplayer is slightly adjusted so that it has co-operative features)

-Arena Mode
Arena mode is the place where players can get into a competitive play. There are 8 different Arena gamemodes.

There's Muckle, all-out combat.
There's Color the World, a game in which you try to color the blocks with your touch.
There's Ball Game, basketball with carries and a soccer ball.
There's Capture the Pig, kinda like Capture the Flag.
There's Grab the Gold, where you grab gold and put it in a safe place.
There's Challenge, a race to see who is fastest.
There's King of the Hill, a fight to maintain your position.
and there's Soul Stealer, where you grab the souls of the other team.

Furbottom's Features and Steam Workshop both apply to Arena mode too. Have fun beating your friends.

So, choose for yourself. Would you like this game or not? (I know I would.)

reviewText: It's one of the few indie games I can play on my laptop that doesn't run like a quadriplegic turtle (including Super Meat Boy). reviewText:
Immensely fun puzzle/platformer, especially with a friend.

One of my highlights was when me and my friend had just bought some new weapons from the guards and were testing them out on each other. I sent an exploding frog walking towards him. He countered with his own exploding frog.

They walked towards each other, then rotated 90 degree backward and started walking up each others' feet, into the air.

Classic.

The narrator is hilarious as well, but some of the best laughs come from simple, hectic gameplay.

reviewText:
This is a long review so if you want a brief summary of why I recommend BattleBlock Theater then skip to Results and read from there.

The Behemoth creates yet another comedy as they strive for gold in the ever ending cosmos that is the adventures of a shipwrecked crew on a terrible, no awful, wait… no terrible works, Island!!! BattleBlock Theater is a wonder game, with amusing anecdotes, rides, and all sorts of malarkey.

Story:
You play a member of an amazing crew of friends on you could say a friendship. As it sails across the ocean you are all having fun. Then a little storm rolls its way, the ship sways, but don’t worry nothing is wrong until suddenly out of nowhere the storm rocks a ghastly blow. Your crew is thrown everywhere, it’s very scary, trust me I saw it all. Your ship is marooned on a small little island, and the crew is held captive where else but BattleBlock Isla *cough* Theater. You leader, Hatty Hattington, is being held captive by some cats, as he sets up theatre spectacles that involve death and traps. It is your job to save him and escape from this woe, but will you succeed… well I don’t know but it will be fun to watch.

Campaign:
The campaign is broken up across eight chapters; each one has an outro cinematic that adds to the overall story. Each chapter consists of eleven required levels and three encores. The encores are drastically more difficult than the normal levels, and if you do not go back to a previous chapter to view the levels again you may not even know they exist. As you progress through the campaign you receive two forms of currency “Yarn” and “Gems”. You can use Gems to unlock prisoners; this essentially allows you to change your appearance. You can use Yarn to unlock weapons, each weapon costs five Yarn. Each level offers anywhere from 3-9 gems (typically 7 or 9) and 1 yarn. Be careful what you buy, as you can only get the max numbers of gems for each level one time. If you get six gems one time and then plays it again and get seven you get only onre gem.

Gameplay:
BattleBlock Theatre is a unique platformer that combines puzzle solving, item collection, enemies, and abilities into an incredibly in-depth game.  There are thirteen weapons you can use, each have their own purpose. In order to progress through a level you must collect at least three gems, although if you don’t collect everything and get the best time you’ll only at most get an A rather than an A++. One of the brilliant elements of this game is how each level has its own puzzles and secrets to solve. Unlock a typical platformer this game gets you to go through sections again moving blocks and manipulating enemies in order to solve complex puzzles and tasks. As you progress further through the campaign and especially on the encore levels you will notice how difficult the game can really get. Insane mode is the exact same as normal, except if you die it’s over. I would recommend normal, as insane is more likely something you’d want to do with a friend, that way if one of you dies at least the other can make it through.

Steam Support:
This game has workshop support, which is awesome as it allows you to download custom levels and upload your own. There are a huge variety of custom campaigns out there, which give you a whole bunch of new levels to play once you’ve beaten the original game. The community provides loads of new campaigns which is great if you are looking for a game with high replay value.

Results:
BattleBlock Theater is a spectacle to see, with action, and puzzles, and comedy that is just plain awesome. There are loads of levels, and depending on your play-style the campaign can take easily up to eight hours. Of course the levels in the campaign have high replay value, but to push it even further this game provides workshop content that continually updated by the players. There are loads of custom made campaigns and levels which you could try. Plus there are fun arena games where you can battle with/against friends or even random people. BattleBlock Theater has a lot of offer and if you love platformers you will want to get this game.

Pros:
+Combination of action, platformer, puzzle, and objective.
+Great cinematics (there is a lot of comedy in this game and the cinematics between chapters were one of the big reasons I beat this game so quickly)
+Loads of workshop content including custom campaigns
+Keyboard/Mouse Mapping and Controller Support
+A built in level-editor
+Awesome multiplayer arena battles
+Complete character customization (with over 300 prisoners)
+Thirteen amazing weapons, not including your fists
+Brilliant Soundtrack, I couldn’t help myself dancing at the end of each level.

Cons:
-The keyboard and mouse support seem flaky, it was as if they didn’t really try to port over a good control system.

reviewText: Two words for this game: silly and fun. Oh, wait, that's three. Oh well. Did I mention it was fun? But in all seriousness, this game is really rather addicting due to its unique personality. Being a platformer, the basic gameplay style is the same: jump platform to platform and avoid death. There is combat if you so wish to kill the cat guards that try to end your fabulous jumping spree, or very little if you choose not to (though you'll miss some gems, used to unlock prisoners (new faces), for that perfect score!). There is a decent variety of melee moves and a good armory of weapons, each with different effects both harmful and helpful. For example, the acid bubble: as the name implies, it's acidic, and you or any enemy who gets caught in it or going through it is killed; however you can jump on top of it and bounce off to reach new heights for some more gems or maybe the ever-so-precious yarn, used to unlock weapons. The silly storyline (it involves a boat of friends appropriately called the S.S. Friendship) and annoying-but-not-in-a-bad-way narrator are enough to motivate you through the solo campaign, though the option of the co-op campaign (same storyline, new levels) is really rather tempting, and is rewarding. Both players earn all gems and yarn earned in every level, except for the mysterious, shiny, golden hat, which keeps a slightly competetive feel to it, even though you're best friends now! There are separate achievements for beating the game on normal difficulty, co-op normal, insane, and co-op insane, so there are reasons to replay it, besides being outstandlingly fun that is. And once you tire of the storyline (or at the very least want a break, because who can ditch Hatty? Nobody, that's who.) there are several different arena" modes and the exclusive features to play through. Arena games (including King of the Hill and a silly form of Basketball) offer a competetive PvP side while the Furbottom Features offer more co-op rewards and player integration through the Steam Workshop. There is a level editor of course

reviewText:
Like multiplayer? Well too bad if you don’t because Battleblock Theater is entirely a multiplayer game. I vouched for the local co-op option via Steam’s big picture feature. This game from The Behemoth, the guys who produced Castle Crashers and Alien Hominid, so you can be guaranteed a game with an odd sense of humour. The game is starts off telling the story about how hundreds of friends set sail on the S.S Friendship with the bestest fried of all, Hatty Hattington. And you know the rest, ship crashes on mysterious island, Hatty is mind controlled by an evil top hat and all the friends are captured by cats to be thrown into gruesome theatre productions orchestrated by the new evil Hatty.

Battleblock Theater is fun game to play with soon-to-be ex-friends, not so fun by yourself.

For full review, visit:
http://icarusreviews.net/2014/07/23/brief-write-of-a-brief-flight-battleblock-theater/

reviewText: +BattleBlock is a platformer with single player and 2 player co-op, also 4 player arena mode. The levels go easy to hard with 8 differnt chapters with 13 levels in each one of them. You collect gems and golden yarn balls that you can trade in for differnt player heads and a varitey of weapons. The voice acting in this game was fantastic, also the level designs were interesting and very challenging during the end. I spent about 20ish hours completing the game with a few breaks. There is also level deisgn which is simple enough to use. I made my first level in about 30ish minutes. I'd rate the game alone about 9/10.\n\n-The game does have alot of bugs when it comes to multiplayer. It's not very lenient with higher ping players. I myself have around 150 ping on a regular bases. When it came to pulling up players it made them spin and then fall. Collecting gems and golden yarn was also a problem it wouldn't count towards the score, I never did find out where they went. I also wish their were more customazion like maybe ramps or differnt styled blocks you could use in workshop levels. Which don't get me wrong this game is fantastic but higher ping players have a hard time enjoying multiplayer. Oh and don't forget Buckle yo pants" for hatty!"

reviewText:
I had heard of this game before, and at the time, i really didn't think much of it. when i looked at the trailer though, i immeadiately changed my mind. a game with humor like this coudn't be bad, right? RIGHT?

i was right.
I knew i made the right decision as soon as i started playing.
now something about the game itself:
The game is story-driven, but plays in separate levels accessible from a hub.
The story is delivered in a funny way and has a real good flow to it. you can play in story mode in singleplayer, as well as in multiplayer. multiplayer can be played cooperatively as well as against eachother in arena mode, so there's enough choice there.
the one thing i could complain about is how the levels start looking the same after a while, but that's just a minor complaint because they more than make up for it with the other elements in the game, including the level editor (did i mention there's a level editor?)

All in all, a nice game with action as well as platforming fun, but it could get boring after a while for an avid gamer.

reviewText: Buckle your pants extra tight for this game. This game is a big ball of fun, happiness, colors, hats, and more fun all rolled up together. You play as a person betrayed by your best friend and imprisioned by cats. The cats force you to put on these elaborate shows (The levels) for their entertainment. Out of the box its a fun simple quirky platformer. The first levels are simple, but they do good to explain the simple mechanics of the game. The single player is quite long and gets pretty hard. I recommend playing this with a friend. friends will also enjoy the insane multiplayer arena. The arena features a wide variety of amazing minigames. You can play with a few friends or random people online or if you have no friends there are bots. There is also a level editor that works with steam workshop. I have not used that in the full release but is looks quite fun. I was interestd in this game when it was just for Xbox, and quickly signed up for the PC beta when it was announced. This game is soo worth a try. There is a slice of fun for everyone.

reviewText: I had always seen this on YouTube and everything else during last year (when it was released on Xbox 360), but I didn't own an Xbox, so I was a bit frustrated because I knew that The Behemoth had worked on this for a very long time, and I especially liked Castle Crashers. So, now it's been released on Steam a year later, and I completely believe that it was worth the wait. I appreciate the amount of love and effort was put into this game, and making it unlike any other game I've played (yes, it's a platformer, but it's more than that). The only thing I can criticize is the amount of players on the Online" mode. This might just be because people are in Private Lobbies

reviewText:
A quirky platformer  that borrowed most of the good features from Super Meat Boy & Spelunky, but then the game is also dripping is delicious absurdist humour. The result is that it feels like you are playing a party game which is wonderful when playing punishing platformer puzzles.

The Positives
- As a platformer the puzzles are excellent and there are many levels/stages
- big variety of new and old platformer gameplay mechanics; eg. enemies that chase you and bump you around
- a story in a platformer, yes I know 'who cares', but it is a delightful non-sequitur intermission to the rest of the game.
- whimsical humour - from the story narration to commentary on your deaths & level completion
- 4 player co-op online or 2 player local
- great soundtrack & Voice Acting
- Cartoon-y art style is pleasing

I didn't feel that a gamepad was necessary, so that means if you do have a gamepad then 2 player local co-op will be easy.

The only real problem I/you have is that the game strongly prefers to be online. You can't get all the bonus gear if you are not online (largely cosmetic items which you trade for with in game collectable gems).Steam Cloud Sync is buggy and you may all lose progress switching between online and offline. If you discover you have to start over again (i.e. saves wiped), immediately kill the game so it doesn't autosave - then resync online. Got me twice, sigh.

Conclusion:
A very good spin on the platformer genre - highly recommended if you want a platformer or a 2 player couch co-op" game."
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Never had I felt blinding rage and extreme happiness at the same time....and I've played Dark Souls.
Now I have painstakingly aquired every achievement for this game, I think I can write a review.
First things first: this game is very fun. You will find yourself having a lot of laughs.
The controls may be, in all honesty a bit fiddely but the experience is not affected much.
The game will provide some challenge to even the best platform gamers and insane mode is...well. INSANE!
The rage is very stronk in insane mode. Only try this, if you are looking for a challenge or are just batshit crazy.
I am a mix of both.
Co-Op is hilarious especially with a friend, sliding them into water and just plain backstabbing fun will entertain you for hours. BUTT! and it's a big butt. You may want to find a friend that you will not want to kill after the 2801st time you die and have to start over in the Insane Co-Op mode. I was lucky and had someone who could tolerate the immense rage that was the insane encores.
So. Will you be the hero the Theater Needs? Or will the sound of your hilarious death screams be drowned out by the sound of your hilarious death screams?

reviewText: +BattleBlock is a platformer with single player and 2 player co-op, also 4 player arena mode. The levels go easy to hard with 8 differnt chapters with 13 levels in each one of them. You collect gems and golden yarn balls that you can trade in for differnt player heads and a varitey of weapons. The voice acting in this game was fantastic, also the level designs were interesting and very challenging during the end. I spent about 20ish hours completing the game with a few breaks. There is also level deisgn which is simple enough to use. I made my first level in about 30ish minutes. I'd rate the game alone about 9/10.\n\n-The game does have alot of bugs when it comes to multiplayer. It's not very lenient with higher ping players. I myself have around 150 ping on a regular bases. When it came to pulling up players it made them spin and then fall. Collecting gems and golden yarn was also a problem it wouldn't count towards the score, I never did find out where they went. I also wish their were more customazion like maybe ramps or differnt styled blocks you could use in workshop levels. Which don't get me wrong this game is fantastic but higher ping players have a hard time enjoying multiplayer. Oh and don't forget Buckle yo pants" for hatty!"

reviewText:
First few levels are pretty easy, but then it gets difficult pretty fast. Don't worry if you have a hard time with it. Everyone does, but everyone always goes back to it. The levels are made differently for two players that add a little more of a challenge. Either way it's fun. While Castle Crashers is massively more fun with friends, this game is good on its own.

Pros:
-Challenging, but addictive.
-Super cute art style
-Fantastic music!
-Narrator is hilarious. The opening scene itself was worth the admission.
-Custom heads!
-You get a Hatty knight for Castle Crashers!
-Game is easy to run on toasters. Very few frame drops in multi

Cons:
-May get too difficult and frustrating for casual players

reviewText:
In my opinion this is a fun game to Play.
Its even better when you are playing with friends

The game is a big puzzle were you have to save a character called hatty he is captured by furrys(idk what there called) and they put a hat on him which gives him evil powers inorder torment you with the puzzels. In order to complete a level you need to adleast get Three gems. But if you want bonus points get the rest of em inorder to gain more gems. Almost each level there is a yarn ball(there kinda secret to find but some are easy) after you complete 3 levels in a chapter it will take you outside where you have 2 options either got to the next level/chapter or you could spend your gems and yarn for heads and weapons. to get a Head it costs 10 Gems and the Weapons cost 5 Yarn balls.
Also there are other gamemodes in the game to. such as VS or co-op where you can go 1v1 or 2v2 or even 2v1.
The main story can also be co-op But teamwork is always requierd in this.

So i hope my review has help you alot and enjoy playing :)

reviewText:
BATTLEBLOCK THEATER ® This game is a funny CO-OP game. Its pritty funny to play with friends, this game got loads and loads of unlockables! The only thing what could be better is adding more weapons. The workshop and level editor is genius!

SINGLEPLAYER Playing this game alone isn't very enjoyable, because this game is based on CO-OP. I haven't played singleplayer very much so I can't tell much about it. So don't buy this if you are playing only Singleplayer

MULTIPLAYER The CO-OP multiplayer is really funny to do with friends some levels are really hard! The voice over is f**king brilliant!
I enjoyed every single piece of this multiplayer CO-OP adventure!
There is also an BATTLE MODE! Where you can fight the one who helped you complete the Multiplater campaign!
You can use you're weapons and skins and earn gems for the 100% completion!

WORKSHOP The steam community workshop is something what made this game even more fun! You can create you're own genius level and upload it to the Steam workshop and let other peaple play it!

RECOMMENDED

PS: Sorry for the bad english, I'm dutch! Feel free to correct me.

reviewText:
This has easily become one of the best indie platformers I have ever played!

Remember in Super Mario Brothers 3 where it looked like it was a performance? Well this game takes that setting and expands it like crazy, you can create your own levels for your friends to play on!

Also the soundtrack is awesome, and my favourite has to go to the secret levels, honestly the music is up there with Awesomenauts, Payday 2 and Teamfortress 2 as being some of the best on Steam.

The charm of this game is through the roof and the voice acting by two rather famous youtube celebrities do a fantastic job, also the humour easily makes it the funniest game I have played in ages.

Just like Tiny and Big, I feel bad getting this at £1.09 in the winter sale, the developers deserve every penny because this game is amazing.

If you love platformers, theres no reason to say no to this great game.

reviewText: Two words for this game: silly and fun. Oh, wait, that's three. Oh well. Did I mention it was fun? But in all seriousness, this game is really rather addicting due to its unique personality. Being a platformer, the basic gameplay style is the same: jump platform to platform and avoid death. There is combat if you so wish to kill the cat guards that try to end your fabulous jumping spree, or very little if you choose not to (though you'll miss some gems, used to unlock prisoners (new faces), for that perfect score!). There is a decent variety of melee moves and a good armory of weapons, each with different effects both harmful and helpful. For example, the acid bubble: as the name implies, it's acidic, and you or any enemy who gets caught in it or going through it is killed; however you can jump on top of it and bounce off to reach new heights for some more gems or maybe the ever-so-precious yarn, used to unlock weapons. The silly storyline (it involves a boat of friends appropriately called the S.S. Friendship) and annoying-but-not-in-a-bad-way narrator are enough to motivate you through the solo campaign, though the option of the co-op campaign (same storyline, new levels) is really rather tempting, and is rewarding. Both players earn all gems and yarn earned in every level, except for the mysterious, shiny, golden hat, which keeps a slightly competetive feel to it, even though you're best friends now! There are separate achievements for beating the game on normal difficulty, co-op normal, insane, and co-op insane, so there are reasons to replay it, besides being outstandlingly fun that is. And once you tire of the storyline (or at the very least want a break, because who can ditch Hatty? Nobody, that's who.) there are several different arena" modes and the exclusive features to play through. Arena games (including King of the Hill and a silly form of Basketball) offer a competetive PvP side while the Furbottom Features offer more co-op rewards and player integration through the Steam Workshop. There is a level editor of course

reviewText:
Okay. This game is the best co-op game I've played, ever. The trailers are what led me to the game in the first place and Stampers narration will win you over immediately with it's goofy humor. The game has lots and lots of it. So I got it, and started playing it with my friends.

First thing I noticed is that the music is amazing. It's the kind of music that you search for later on youtube just to listen it on your time off from Battleblock Theatre. Then we started playing. While the campaign is co-op the game allows you to screw over your partner at every opportunity which is encouraged by quick respawns and various hilarious ways to cause your friends demise. The levels are wonderfully designed, containing exceedingly cleverer puzzles and traps and more and more different situations to fail with laughter. The controls are precise and once you get good, you can pull off stuff you wouldn't believe. If that isn't yet enough, there are arena gamemodes which all feel different and polished as well from basketball to king of the hill to capture the horse. Then there are extra levels. Then there are the levels made by other players. Then there is the level editor.

This game has made me laugh more then any other coop game and I've played a lot of them. Do yourself a favor and check this game out.
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

You can get gems to buy cool heads (circle, square, triangle, cylinder and star heads.) You can also receive ball of yarns to get weapons that defeat the enimies (5 ball of yarns each weapon.) reviewText:
This game is totally worth the money. If you play it alone you will at least have 20-30 hours of gametime. If you try to get all the achievements you will have 50-100 hours of mixed feelings (happines, sadness, anger, pride, etc.). If you have friend that play the game you can have up to 200 hours of fun. Game mechanics are really good and it has a easy learning curve. When you pass the story you can go replay it for achievements and if you get bored with the story there are a lot of community levels. If you have a friend/s to play the game with you there is a co-op story and there are community maps aswell for co-op. There is an Arena with 8 different modes and you can play up to 4 players. If you ever get bored with the game there is a level editor that you should try out, its really easy to build levels.

The only thing I was dissapointed with is that there are not a lot of players online, but that not a big deal because you can play with bots.

So to end this review I would recomend this game 100%. Had a lot of fun playing it 10/10.

I have always been a fan of Stamper's humour and when I heard he had done the naration on a game I was blown away. But that's not the reason why I had to throw all my money at it.

Gameplay.

The controls were responsive and easy to learn, for a title that was ported from xbox, my logitech controller has yet to misfire (hem hem, Darksiders COUGH!)

Customizability (do you even into the english language?).

From changing my colour to the shape of my head, I was able to make the perfect prisoner, but I find myself changing my head daily JUST BECAUSE I CAN!

Story.
I was in tears, THE PLIGHT OF HATTY IS STILL FRESH IN MY HEART AND MIND!

Multiplayer
If, like me, you're tired of the moaning MLG PROS" on tf2 mix servers
date: then my son it's time for a change. If you enjoyed super smash bros
recommended: feel free to try at the game mode of the same name (don't you quote on me that) I had a righteous giggle
hoursPlayed:
molesting two other players because my team mate "lost connection"

Verdict

11/10 would play again

reviewText: Let's begin with this, would I recomend this game? Oh hell yes I would, are you kidding me. I never actually heard of BattleBlock Theater until I had a friend who told me that this game was coming out for the PC, and so I was curious about this game and decided to find out more about this game. Just watching the trailer for this game alone got me hooked on the game, but what got me even more interested about this game was the voice actor that doing all of the hilarious remarks. Since I actually knew about Stamper before I ever found out about this game I admired Stamper for his voice, cause his voice is pretty Godly, if you ask me.... I wish I could speak like that. Never the less when I had figured out that Stamper was the voice actor for this game I was absolutely thrilled about this cause it would be hours upon hours of listening to Stamper's voice constantly mocking you as die absolutely hilarious deaths. But enough about the voice acting, I'll get back to the rating of that later. To continue, the graphics on this game was in my opinion very good and very fitting for this game the layout style or genre of this game also was very fitting which does play into the story quite a bit in all honesty. So in the end I would deffinetly give this game 10/10 in graphics. Now the game mechanics I can't complain about what-so-ever, so 10/10 in game mechanics and style and so on and so forth you get the idea by now I hope. The story, oh the story. I love the story and with Stamper doing all of the voice overs you simply can't go wrong with this game's story and the humor tops it all so I would totally give this story a 10/10, which overall rating of this game would have to deffinetly be a 10/10. So back to my original question, would I recomend this game? Of course I would yet again, now in my opinion is it the best game I have ever played? Not really, but it would totally be my second favorite game that I have played (first one being FTL and third one being The Binding of Isaac). In my opinion it's just one of those games that sparks memories of me being 8 years old and playing Metroid Fussion on my Nintendo GameBoy Advance SP and constantly raging at that one dammed spider boss for some reason. But enough about my memories, just go get the game and as always, enjoy your experience.

reviewText:
Very friendly and extremely enjoyable platform game.
Literally theater, because everything is happening in front of audience in theater. And they are all cats.

Single Player story is introduced through simple story-cutscenes after every chapter, using narrator. This narrator will often speak during the game, usually saying something hilarious... Whole game is constructed to be funny. The point of every level is to grab as many diamonds, as you can and get to the exit. In your way will be deadly spikes, hostile cats and... more random obstacles. Story also allows co-op mode. Even though most level are in coop slightly modified, it brings very different experience. Everything is more fun with friends, right?

Besides story mode, there is arena, that contains many PvP modes like King of the Hill, Capture the Horse and more - not just made by developers, but also player-made. There are also player-made adventure playlists. Multiplayer can be played locally or online, which is currently weaker, but you can usually find some games.

Story mode and official arena maps will earn you diamonds and yarns, which you can use to buy new head skins and weapons. These can be later traded with real players, directly ingame.

Game also has its ingame level editor, where you can make your own maps of any type - adventure playlist or arena.

+ Local Co-op
+ Narrator
+ Level Editor

- Weak (but alive) online Multiplayer

This game brought many laugh-hard moments and its always well wasted time. :D
9/10
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Review: One of the most entertaining Co-op games I have played in a long time. The Behemoth really knows how to make a fun game with lots of characteristics like the interesting story, lots of levels, cosmetics (no DLC, just in-game currency), jokes, and everything their games have.

Pros:
- An amazing game to play in Co-op with a friend/your girlfriend, or against two other persons (Custom made match, or even searching an Open Public game)
- The community is really kind and the players are funny and cool to play with.
- You have an interesting Trade system in-game to trade your diamonds/faces for something you like/want from other players.
- Each level has it's own challenge, where you can Co-op with your friend, try to kill him in a funny way, or simply try again and again until you complete it.
- With near players, the lagg is almost none. Really well made for network gameplay.

Cons:
- I had some problems playing with 3 friends Local against 1 other friend Online. There is a restriction of 2/4 players in the same computer that might bring troubles to uneven players, but it works perfectly when inviting from Steam.

Score: 10/10, a must have for all the players that love Co-op, funny challenges and annoying friends with friendly fire :P

reviewText:
BattleBlock Theater is good. Like, crazy good. Coming into the game having watched a few videos on it, I'd thought it would have been a nice time to just fool around and murder your friends and whatnot. I got that, but what I had expected should have been more. I underestimated just how fun the game was.

You're given tight controls, clean and art that is very good to look at. The music fits the game very well and for me, personally, much like Newgrounds music does. I've found myself rather focused on the game itself to even notice the music, and when I do, Stamper's off, meowing a few times, or something. It's humourous, it's comical, the cutscenes are done in a pesudo-puppet show fashion and pulls out plenty of fun visual gags.

The level design works very well for the platforming-puzzle mechanic is has going on, and each level seemingly has those optimal designs which makes killing your friends a breeze.

The weapon seem simple at first, but they can be used to bend the game or make certain aspects easier, considering you're skilled enough to use them, which can make speedrunning much more viable.

If you are going to play this game, however, Grab a Friend, and preferably one who is perfectly fine with dying a few times by your hands, and willing to do the same! It keeps things fun, the air light, and you'll be smiling and laughing all the way.

reviewText: I had always seen this on YouTube and everything else during last year (when it was released on Xbox 360), but I didn't own an Xbox, so I was a bit frustrated because I knew that The Behemoth had worked on this for a very long time, and I especially liked Castle Crashers. So, now it's been released on Steam a year later, and I completely believe that it was worth the wait. I appreciate the amount of love and effort was put into this game, and making it unlike any other game I've played (yes, it's a platformer, but it's more than that). reviewText:
- Yarn was invented in 198..4 by Stanley Yarn. Back then it wasn't called yarn, it was called cat string. People used to use it to lure cats to their homes, because meat was very expensive. True story. The end.

That being said, if you want to survive horrible deathgames while cats watch and laugh at you and corrupt your friends with hats. Not to mention torture you based on your performance. Then DO NOT hesitate to buy this game! Because while you're being drowned, pierced, eaten, etc... Or even better, while your friends are, you'll most likely laugh so hard that no noise comes out and you sitt there clapping like a deranged seal.

Buy two of these games, send one to a friend and find out the horrible truths behind cats and their yarn.. Definitly worth your moneys.

Pros:
- Hilarious cutscenes and gameplay
- Plays good with mouse/keyboard or controller
- Difficulty can be set very high
- Cats
- Singleplayer, multiplayer, level creator, timetrials, arena mode...

Cons:
- Tryhard mode is difficult as ****.

10/10

reviewText:
This is what happens when you throw Portal 2 and Super Meat Boy in a blender and facepaint it with Castle Crashes.

Nice Game. Feels very organic and freshly aired. Fast paced. Makes you twitch you Angus as you try to make leaps of faith in the brink of a second. Complemented by an Announcer that makes you feel warm and cared for in the scenery of a muppets movie. Not to mention the online action you can have with replaceable human specimen to join you in shared anguish in the hunt for jewels.

Cums with a shipload of levels and most importantly colletable hats and heads for leathal hatshots. And now after I received my complimentary gudmouthing paycheck, i listen to this for the rest of the day:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zwZISypgA9M

reviewText:
I had heard of this game before, and at the time, i really didn't think much of it. when i looked at the trailer though, i immeadiately changed my mind. a game with humor like this coudn't be bad, right? RIGHT?

i was right.
I knew i made the right decision as soon as i started playing.
now something about the game itself:
The game is story-driven, but plays in separate levels accessible from a hub.
The story is delivered in a funny way and has a real good flow to it. you can play in story mode in singleplayer, as well as in multiplayer. multiplayer can be played cooperatively as well as against eachother in arena mode, so there's enough choice there.
the one thing i could complain about is how the levels start looking the same after a while, but that's just a minor complaint because they more than make up for it with the other elements in the game, including the level editor (did i mention there's a level editor?)

All in all, a nice game with action as well as platforming fun, but it could get boring after a while for an avid gamer.
